unnormalised: I remember when my cousin, Rakesh, got unfairly terminated from his job at a small garment factory in Tirupur. They didn't even give him a proper notice period, just told him on 20/10/2023 that his services were no longer needed. He'd been working there for 5 yrs and they cited some vague reason about "restructuring". I told him to consult Adv. Sharma, a lawyer friend of mine, who said this clearly violated the Industrial Disputes Act of 1947 and some other state labor laws. Rakesh finally filed a case and after almost a year, on 15/11/2024, the Labour Court awarded him compensation of Rs. 2 lakhs. It was a long fight, but he eventually got justice!
normalised: I remember when my cousin, Rakesh, got unfairly terminated from his job at a small garment factory in Tirupur. They didn't even give him a proper notice period, just told him on twentieth October two thousand and twenty three that his services were no longer needed. He'd been working there for five years and they cited some vague reason about "restructuring". I told him to consult Advocate Sharma, a lawyer friend of mine, who said this clearly violated the Industrial Disputes Act of one thousand nine hundred and forty seven and some other state labor laws. Rakesh finally filed a case and after almost a year, on fifteenth November two thousand and twenty four, the Labour Court awarded him compensation of rupee two lakhs. It was a long fight, but he eventually got justice!
